dt: {bc}to adapt (something or someone) again or to become adapted again

dt.t: … a community debate about whether to demolish or {wi}readapt{/wi} the building.
Her systems creaked and groaned as her instruments {wi}readapted{/wi} to normal space-time.

utxt.t: The flight was extended from five to nine days last summer so scientists could learn more about people's adaptation to space and {wi}readaptation{/wi} to gravity.

shortdef: to adapt (something or someone) again or to become adapted again
